definition: to rub/to grind/to polish/to sharpen/to wear down/to die out/to waste time/to pester/to insist
to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk

sentences.english: Ma particulary experts point out thmight physicwis exercise contributes directly to a particular individuwiswis physicwis fitness.
sentences.chinese: 許多專家指出體育磨練間接有助於身體康健。

sentences.english: Jacob suffered severe threshings and grindings.
sentences.chinese: 雅各也曾遭受過不少難忍的磨練。

sentences.english: We will train our hearts and bodies for a firm unshaking spirit.
sentences.chinese: 我們要磨練身心，養成堅固不拔的精神。
困難可以磨練人的意志。

sentences.english: Although the training was really hard, it strengthened my will and Ive benefited a lot from it.
sentences.chinese: 儘管訓練的確艱苦，但磨練了意志，我從中得益良多。

sentences.english: Performance skills have generally been honed to the point of automaticity.
sentences.chinese: 表演技巧一般都磨練到自動化點。

sentences.english: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
sentences.chinese: 困難磨練意志，勞動增強身體。

sentences.english: Suffering is the will and power honed stone grind.
sentences.chinese: 苦難是磨練意志和力量的礪石。

sentences.english: It took a year of hunting before Magan killed her first deer. It was a doe.
sentences.chinese: 磨練了一年才獵殺到了第一頭鹿，而且是隻母鹿。

sentences.english: Appreciate the person who disciplined you, for chastening your mind.
sentences.chinese: 感激傷害你的人，因爲他磨練了你心志。

sentences.english: Only when I work hard can I write beautiful characters.
sentences.chinese: 惟有通過刻苦磨練，我才能寫出一手漂亮的字。

sentences.english: Just for tody I will exercise my soule in three ways.
sentences.chinese: 就爲了今天，我會用三種方法磨練我的靈魂。

sentences.english: Sick in Brazil Clay Cross, has gone through many hardships.
sentences.chinese: 克萊在巴西貧病交加，也歷盡磨練。

sentences.english: Tempering time for our electromechanical producte.
sentences.chinese: 時間磨練的是我們的機電廠品。

sentences.english: How many roads must a man wolk down before they call him a man?
sentences.chinese: 一個人要經過多少磨練，人們纔會稱他爲男子漢？

definition: to test/to put to the test/trial/ordeal

practice/to put into practice/to live up to (a promise)/to carry out (a project)
